availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of William Johnson and Lucinda Johnson. Married to Joanna K. Ham Johnson in NIcholas County on May 6, 1850. Father of Alice Johnson and Annie M. Johnson. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1850. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, City/District, p. 491B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, NIcholas County, District 1, p. 371.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Precinct 4, pp. 267B and 268A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film #000252392, p. 141.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 7th Congressional District, Vol. 2, July 1863, p. 189, (Accessed via ancestry.com on March 17, 2020).
